metadata.title: CVE-2020-6823 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: A malicious extension could have calledbrowser.identity.launchWebAuthFlow, controlling theredirect_uri, and through the Promise returned, obtain the Auth code andgain access to the user's account at the service provider. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 75. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1 firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1 firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
